data.title: Chromap
data.description: is an ultrafast method for aligning and preprocessing high throughput chromatin profiles.
data.name: chromap

evidence: README install command: "conda install -c conda-forge -c bioconda chromap"

"Chromap is an ultrafast method for aligning and preprocessing high throughput chromatin profiles. Typical use cases include: (1) trimming sequencing adapters, mapping bulk ATAC-seq or ChIP-seq genomic reads... (3) split alignment of Hi-C reads against a reference genome."
Usage examples show running `./chromap` / `chromap` as a command-line tool to map sequencing reads and produce BED/SAM/pairs outputs, indicating an end-user application rather than a library.
